website_summaries.verdict: An extra-large main pouch and room for two large water bottles make this a good choice for hiking or distance running, though its weight is cumbersome for shorter distances.
pros: Larger waistpack holds large smartphones and plenty of snacks
Fits two large water bottles, which are well-balanced on either side of the main pouch
Features adjustable waist strap and removable shoulder strap
cons: Water bottle pockets can tear with a few days of heavy use
Adjustment may slip during heavy activity, requiring frequent readjustment

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hiking fanny pack!
customer_reviews.text: Sister's review: LOVE my new fanny pack! Haha. It has so much space to store my things when going on a hike. I am able to fit my BlenderBottle and umbrella in each of the side bottle holders. Plenty of space for my phone, keys, phone charger, portable charger, protein bars among other things such as a small camera or my GoPro! I love the color too and it sits well on my hips. No more dealing with backpacks when I go on a hike! Yaaas!
customer_reviews.author: BPP1394

customer_reviews.title: Excellent with one flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pack, flexible fabric, easy to adjust, comfortable, room for two water bottles. It won’t really fit a rain shell with room for much else but an emergency poncho is a good substitute. The one flaw is that when you have it on it is hard to get the water bottle back in its holder. Surprisingly hard. The waist strap goes around the outside of the bottle, and that tension and the different sections of fabric on the holder creates the problem. It’s pretty annoying when hiking actually but I like the rest of the design enough that it’s still 4 stars. I keep hoping I’ll find a way around the problem.
customer_reviews.author: EmmBee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Disney
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our trip to Disney and it was awesome! I love that I was able to wear it in so many ways depending on the situation. I wore it around my waist in the front, around my waist in the back, over my shoulder like a purse, across my body, and sometimes I wore the shoulder strap as well as having it strapped to my front or back. It was very comfortable and I had it pretty full with the following items: water bottles, ID & money, poncho, handheld flat fan, Clorox wipes, small hand sanitizer, sunglasses, gum, ibuprofen, lip balm, sunscreen, and 2 or 3 snacks. I am a female 5'1 about 115 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: JG79

customer_reviews.title: Great for charity walks!
customer_reviews.text: I'm walking in the Breast Cancer 3 Day walk and this has enough room to fit everything I need for training and the walk and is not too wide or bulky that it's going to be annoying. The pink color and bright and just what I wanted. Great pack for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: MN Bakery Girl

customer_reviews.title: Nice hiking pack and great price
customer_reviews.text: This pack is exactly as described. I love that I can carry water for my dog and I, my Nikon L330 camera fits very nicely in the biggest pocket; I can also carry extra batteries and quite a few other things as well. Wearing this around my waist gives me quick and easy access to the camera and the water. It is exactly what I needed. I've been using it on my hikes for a few weeks and it seems to be well made. I was expecting less for the price - which was just right for me - so I am very pleasantly surprise and quite happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sage

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect pack for me
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect pack for me! Holds everything I need on hikes with my dog. It carries my cell phone, a first aid kit, hand sanitizer, pepper spray, utility knife, knife, comb (to remove cactus), tweezers, small flashlight, tissues, wet wipes, folded up garbage bag, dog snacks, dog water bowl, two bottles of water, lip balm, sunscreen. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin L.

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this to take on a trip in summer ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to take on a trip in summer. The first day I used it one of the compartments ripped open and was unusable. I realized what a cheap item it is but was too late. I wish I could return it now.
customer_reviews.author: Payman

customer_reviews.title: Like this pack!
customer_reviews.text: Like this fanny pack a lot. Both my other fanny packs (a cheap off brand and an expensive name brand) are constructed in such a way that my arms hit the water bottles while walking. Not a problem with this pack! The pack seems well-constructed and holds everything I need for long walks on the beach with my poodle. I will update this review to comment on its durability after I have used it for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: MizTree

customer_reviews.title: This brand is well made
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered and received another brand just a few dollars cheaper and it broke before I really got to use it. So I returned it and ordered a brand I trust. I have a smaller Waterfly waist pack that has given good service for months. They use good quality materials, zippers, belt release clasp. I needed a bigger one to hold my Kindle, my wallet, phone, keys and essentials like Stevia packs, kleenex purse pack, lipstick, etc. I use it when I go out shopping or like today, to the Dentist. The side packs hold my heavy metal coffee travel mug and the other side a big case for my sunglasses. It really holds quite a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer JennaW

customer_reviews.title: Fits the Nikon P-900!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a waist pack to use while hiking with my Nikon Coolpix-900. This just fits. I didn't like carrying the camera over my shoulder as it started to hurt so a waist pack was in order. I bought several and finally picked this one as it was the only one to fit my camera, my iPhone-8 Plus AND a water bottle. I still have room for other things but will be taking this baby on trip whether I am hiking or touring a city. The color is a nice purple and I like that too. If you need a nice size waist pack that fits a pretty large camera, get this!@
customer_reviews.author: Debtheweb

customer_reviews.title: Good waist pack for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I use this when I do bike rides over three hours. I usually put two gatorades in the bottle sections and they have never fallen out. There is sufficient room for a phone, sandwich, a cool rag and light rain jacket. There are a number of sections so that you stuff can be separated easily . This is will not be good for running as it will bounce, however should be perfect for walking or hiking. I also think that the straps need to be tighten as least once every two hours.
customer_reviews.author: JAB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size & made with quality
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I did NOT get this bag for free, and I still love it. Outstanding quality & good medium sized pack Pockets- even the front one- easily holds my iPhone 6Plus in a case. The waist strap and padded support will be great when I pack it full for a flight, hike, or trip to Disneyland. Bottle holders fit standard water bottles easily and the pockets are deep enough for taller bottles to stay put. I've warn through a bunch of waist packs and believe this one will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Lori A. Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Good size but the straps are such a pain!
customer_reviews.text: I had an Everest fanny pack but I wanted one with a bottle holder, so I bought this. It is plenty big, and once I figured out that I needed to undo the straps over the bottle holder pouch, the bottle fit, but the waist straps are just a nightmare. They won't stay in place. Constantly loosening at the buckle, with the result being the pack sliding down while I'm on my ride or on my walk. I've gotten to the point where I'm having to attach a binder clip on each side to secure the two edges of the strap and keep them from shifting.
customer_reviews.author: catlady

customer_reviews.title: A good product except
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. It has wide comfortable straps. But, the clasp is a little difficult to fasten. Sadly, every brand uses the same clasp. The pouches are very roomy. I use mine to carry 4 water bottles and plastic bowls, and treats, for my dogs. That's 5-6 lbs. The biggest problem is if you put more than 3lbs in the pack, the strap adjuster slips, loosening the strap. The pack constantly loosens while walking. I am always having to "hike it up, and pulling on the strap. Again, this is the only system that seems to be available, on any brand.
customer_reviews.author: Geo Dan

customer_reviews.title: ... a 10 mile walk this morning and this was pretty awesome. I am preparing for the Komen 60 ...
customer_reviews.text: I took a 10 mile walk this morning and this was pretty awesome. I am preparing for the Komen 60 mile walk, so wanted to make sure this would do the trick. You can put a ton in this pack and it has good back support. I wore it lower on my waist and had it turned around so the weight was on my back. Everything tightens down nicely so there is nothing falling out. It is very well constructed and I can see taking it snow skiing as well. You can load it up.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Useful and well-made!
customer_reviews.text: Love this pack. If you don't fill the middle pocket, it actually fits water bottles that are a tiny bit bigger than listed! I use it every time I go on a hike to carry two .8 litre bottles because I don't like having a sweaty back. My only wish is that they would extend the padding on the straps, because the straps kind of press on my hip bones. But it doesn't bother me too badly, so I didn't lower my rating for it.
customer_reviews.author: Dmascarenhas

customer_reviews.title: Great as a camera bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for field photography, as a replacement for the rigid and bulky camera case that came as part of my dSLR package. The two sleeves intended for carrying water bottles do excellent service to hold a pair of spare lenses. The large pocked is actually big enough to hold the camera with its "normal" lens - though I use it that way only for storage, not when I'm out in the field. At that time, the big pocket will carry a canteen of water. The other pockets carry smaller accessories, and the whole things fits comfortably on my waist. This is exactly what I was hoping for!
customer_reviews.author: William M

customer_reviews.title: Mary Poppins bag! Never ending space!
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a diaper bag technically but while hiking since I carry one baby on my back and one in the front- Im able to carry diapers and whites snacks wallet extra Socks and hats knife and everything else including the kids water bottles. Love that I can sinch the sidesto hold bottles into place or make it thinner when we aren’t packing as much. I would recommend because I’ve had for 3 months now and have tossed this thing around and it’s all still holding up great. Sort of like a MaryPoppins bag- I keep finding space to fit more into it!
customer_reviews.author: The Aazads

customer_reviews.title: Goldilocks bag for me...
customer_reviews.text: I am using this bag for light hiking/birding. Carrying pretty light stuff when walking with maybe a small field book and water. Other items are optical cleaning wipes, bug spray, small 1st aid supplies, compass and a bottle of water. I put a pair of 10x42 binos in to travel, but they don't get carried there on the trail. I also put a Viltox camera mount on the belt for a Lumnix camera. It carries well, is comfortable and has decent organize / compartment size balance. I have gone thru a number of belt bags for this type of use, some too big, some too heavy, some to small...this one is being just right.
customer_reviews.author: J. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! Useful!
customer_reviews.text: A WONDERFUL USEFUL PURCHASE! This bag is no farce. It's well designed, comfortable, multifaceted/utility. Even the lightest of backpacks give me a nagging gnawing pain......but I feel no pain using this pack. I have used this fanny as my every day bag since i've unpackaged it. Life changer.
customer_reviews.author: Rube

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t disappoint
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this Fanny pack. It’s very comfortable and works perfect. You can either use one or two water bottles and it will still feel comfortable. We use it for or hikes with our two year old and he was even able to sit on it while on a piggy back ride and it didn’t break. Made it a little easier for us. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, except for one thing.
customer_reviews.text: I like this pack very much. It can hold a surprising amount of stuff. My only problem was that adjustable waist belt kept loosening, so I couldn't keep it up around my waist. I sewed Velcro on the belt and loose ends and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Patsy

customer_reviews.title: Good Pack - except for the bottle holders
customer_reviews.text: Very frustrated with the water bottle holders. The elastic around the top of the drink holders is too flimsy. It's difficult to get the water bottle back in the holder with the pack still on your back . I sometimes have to ask someone to put my water bottle back in the pack for me, or I have to take off the pack to put it back in. Other than that, it's a good pack. I'll just have to MacGyver the bottle holders to make them more rigid.
customer_reviews.author: JimK - Cascade Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Very useful!
customer_reviews.text: This has served a great purpose as a hiking pack for me! I baby wear when I hike and can't carry a back pack so this has been ideal. I carry at least one water bottle, some snacks, my phone and keys and sometimes a diaper and wipes! It's spacious and comfortable. I am also plus sized and it fits me just fine! Great budgeg friendly waist pack! I also love the color. Would def recommend
customer_reviews.author: MamaBearbear

customer_reviews.title: This thing is massive!
customer_reviews.text: This ended up being FAR bigger than I'd had in mind. Photos of my 40 oz bottle inside to show the compartment storage area. I feel like it could hold an entire 6 pack 😂 ... if I'm ever in need of something this size this would be the product I'd choose.
customer_reviews.author: tiredandold

customer_reviews.title: Waterfly/ Superfly
customer_reviews.text: I hike each and everyday with my 2 dogs. I always bring a bunch of stuff in a fanny pack. My other one I had previous to Waterfly was very good & I had it a long time. I wanted something different, strong, so I could hold what I need. I only have it a few days. It is most comfortable, I am able to put lots of stuff I need in it. So far - so good. Hoping it will last for years. Good product. I a sure it is water-resistant, although it didn't rain while on my hikes. Extremely comfortable & I really do like it.
customer_reviews.author: patricia columbo

customer_reviews.title: Not as roomy as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: I love fanny packs - clearly I'm a fashionista - but this one was a little too small for me. It's good for walking the dog, room for my phone and poop bags, but not for a day at the zoo. It's a nice addition to my collection, but I use it the least.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any adventure
customer_reviews.text: Great functional fanny pack. I used this to carry snacks onto a plane for a long flight. I used it on a 2 mile hike down into a volcano and back out of it. Wore this while hiking through thick woods, over large rocks and through a creek to get to a waterfall. Took it to multiple beaches too. I got lots of compliments and a lot of people wished they had one as well.
customer_reviews.author: Blubblub

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but you have to readjust the size every time you put it on
customer_reviews.text: I liked this waist pack overall. I've been using it for a few weeks now and it is sturdy, well-designed, and works as advertised. The main thing I didn't like about it is the sizing straps are held by a tension clasp, so they slip easily if the pack isn't on very tight. The clasps don't retain their position well when not warn either, so you have to readjust the size every time you put it on. That is just a minor annoyance though. I ended up just using a zip-tie to keep things in place, but this could have been avoided with a locking clasp on the straps.
customer_reviews.author: D.H. Merlin

customer_reviews.title: This fancy pack works great for my trail running
customer_reviews.text: This fancy pack works great for my trail running. It replaces my different, older pack that I broke. The tight, elastic water bottle bands are great for securely holding bottles. Three compartments, overall capacity enough for a simple first aid kit, and other stuff. Other reviewers commented on the strap loosening while its being worn, which I haven't yet noticed despite being bounced around on a run.
customer_reviews.author: Fellrunner

customer_reviews.title: I am so pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a fanny pack that held two water bottles and had lots of room and this pack fits the bill. I am so pleased with it. I am an avid hiker and usually carry a camelback backpack with me and use this an extra. I have a place for my sunscreen, my phone, snacks and a few other items that I can easily reach while walking... The waist strap is long which will work well for most people of varying sizes. I am small and so I have a long tail of strap..... Highly recommend and and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: glinda

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this product. The clips slip on the belt are cheap and it constantly needs to be tightened or it will fall off your waist.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Holds quite a bit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fanny pack for when I go on walks, especially with my oldest son, so we could tote 2 water bottles without having to hold them in our hands the whole time. It works nicely. It also holds everything I need (ID, phone, keys, sunscreen, tissues, etc.) with room to spare. I was even able to pack a small book in the largest pocket. I like to use the strap like a cross-body bag and then fasten the waist belt to keep it from banging around. Overall a very good fanny pack.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These packs are amazing! To me, it’s much more comfortable than wearing a backpack, because I can wear the weight on my hips. It will hold two 24 oz. Contigo water bottles, plenty of snacks, sunscreen, and other necessities. These are a must have for our family hikes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this pack
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is a great pack. Lots of zip spaces for hiking needs. Fits great - easy to adjust - lightweight. I would give it a perfect 10 of 10 except for one thing. The water bottle holders are flimsy - made of mesh (which could easily tear) and the top of the holders are flimsy and collapse. I wrote to the company about it. Oh they were glad to hear from me....ya think? My husband wiggled some rubber straps into the top hem to try to keep the openings OPEN. Maybe they designed it so people would carry it in front of their bodies? Not me - when I hike my pack goes on my back waist.
customer_reviews.author: A. Z. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Just what I had hope
customer_reviews.text: Delivery, packaging, quality of workmanship are all as expected. First use was for a short mountain hike and it was large enough to carry windbreaker gear, phone, lunch, and water. Serves well on its intended use.
customer_reviews.author: RABit

customer_reviews.title: Great size and comfortable - holds my camera gear nicely
customer_reviews.text: Works great for carrying my camera on light hikes. I have a micro 4/3 mirrorless camera and it fits nicely along with a big lens in the main compartment. That still leaves me a generous amount of room for accessories, cell phone, keys etc in the other sections. And a neat place to carry my water bottle away from everything else. It's comfortable carrying my gear in front or when I don't take my camera, I wear it in back. I just had to knock off a star though for the annoying logo and slogan. Got some fabric paint and covered it up.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Smith

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product That's Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Well thought out fanny pack with lots of pockets and 2 water bottle holders. Very comfortable to wear and easily adjusted to fit and suit the needs of the wearer.
customer_reviews.author: Janet K.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and has storage but...
customer_reviews.text: I really like how light it is and it does have compartments, but wished the padded for the back was better. It feels like a corrugated cardboard box. The logo is so big, why show it on the front at least put it on the side. If you are a guy it looks weird that you are using a female fanny pack. The zipper seems okay but will update if it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Blinkit Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great pack, but...
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this pack 5 stars except for one thing. The largest pocket, closest to the top of the bag. When you open the pocket fully, the zipper goes down on each side next to the water bottles and is really difficult to grasp the zipper pulls because of the water bottles. If they had used a slightly shorter zipper so that the pulls stay on top of the bag, it would have been perfect! Otherwise, the bag is perfect! I use it for walking my dog everyday. I put her 30' long lead into the largest pocket, and poop bags in the small pocket and a few essential items in the middle pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Gregory

customer_reviews.title: No Mask Delivery
customer_reviews.text: The product was fine, as described on Amazon. The delivery driver was not wearing a mask, did not speak English and did not understand instructions to place the package on the ground and back away. TIGHTEN UP, AMAZON
customer_reviews.author: Karen Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great for carrying water and other stuff
customer_reviews.text: If you need water at the beach, while hiking, or elsewhere, this pack is great. It holds 2 16-oz. bottles (or other sizes--the bottle holders are adjustable). If I'm on the beach, I have to have water for my dog, or she'll drink the salt water and get sick. Also great for carrying water on a hike. It has several zipper pockets and compartments. One is perfect for your cell phone. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: I’m a fan
customer_reviews.text: Omg this bag is so stinking cute. I was a little embarrassed because I was finally old enough to be ok with buying a fanny pack. I didn’t think I would love it, but I knew it would be functional for little day hikes with the dogs. I ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT. I got the water bottles that they make for it as well and the whole thing is perfect. Plenty of space for keys, wallet, snacks, and my giant phone. Then of course all the dog stuff. Well made. Looks cute, but more importantly it’s very functional.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: Holds lots of stuff
customer_reviews.text: Able to carry substantial amount of small items. No water bottles included but got 2 at the dollar store that work great. Use it frequently for hiking with the dogs; carrying treats, wipes, water, small emergency kit. Would highly recommend that a small interior zip pocket be placed inside the large pocket closest to the belt as a secure place to put credit card, ID and keys. Just too much chance of those items falling out of the other pockets if not securely zipped.
customer_reviews.author: grizziesmom

customer_reviews.title: Large, versatile fanny pack
customer_reviews.text: This is a great large fanny pack! I bought it to take hiking. I was out with my troop and it held our whole First Aid Kit and my snack, water bottle, wallet, phone, keys, and still had a little extra space. The straps are wide so it never felt too bulky. There is even spacers to ensure air flow between your skin and the straps. It even tightens enough for my kids to wear it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Kibrick

customer_reviews.title: Great for light hiking, a couple of drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Wish there were a 3.5 option. Great idea and a ton of options packed into this thing. Two biggest issues: 1. Mesh and buckles seem flimsy, like they'll tear or break at any time (haven't yet!). 2. When fully loaded with water/snacks, the pack is not as snug and you wouldn't want to jog. A shoulder strap option would be perfect. Otherwise good overall investment for the price, ideal for anyone doing lighter hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love this pack, but sorely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The pack is awesome when you first get it, but don't expect to be able to use it. After a half day at Disney, using only one of the two water-bottle holders and nothing really heavy, the waist strap broke when the cheap plastic bent and separated. In addition, one of the inner zippers ripped free, making the two pockets merge into one. Another seam on it also seems about to go, but I can't use it as a fanny pack now. I had to purchase a bag at the theme-park. I'm fortunate I was not using this while camping or hiking. It would have been more inconvenient to break on that kind of adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Dazzling Dani

customer_reviews.title: Excellent size for half-day hiking
customer_reviews.text: I used it to carry a 12 oz( for a kid) and a 20 oz water bottles easily. Several pockets to carry iPhone, snacks, and other stuff. Big enough to carry two water bottles and a lot of snacks for a half-day hiking. Small enough not to interfere with walking and simple activities. Much more convenient than a backpack. The material looks beautiful and feels good.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Princeton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get to water and other items.
customer_reviews.text: For long hikes I wear a regular backpack, but for the in-town, 2 or 3 hour hikes I can get my lunch, 2 water bottles, and the 1st aide kit in the Waterfly. So it's just perfect. I always struggle with removing things from my regular backpack, but with this one, I can just pull it around and get what I need. I get compliments on it.
customer_reviews.author: archrisie

customer_reviews.title: fits nicely
customer_reviews.text: I wore this thing this weekend while hiking locally. It was quiet comfortable, I am 5'2 and 120ish, It held two full sized camelbak insulated water bottles nicely. It also held my phone and snack perfectly. It doesn't fit around the hips per se, but more like where an actual hiking backpack waist belt would sit. So if you have a bit of pudge in the front, yeah it's going to cut in. I thought it fit nicely and it was extremely comfortable, which matters to me most.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: waterfly fashion good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Lots of snow left in the Sierra's. June 1st used the waterfly sport pouch for the first time. small water bottle for dog on one side & a little larger water bottle for me the other. Only negative is my bottle was lost while hiking; may have been while adjusting my snowshoe. Positive 3 roomy pouches front pouch carried my android phone fit great. middle pouch carries crampon (size small) with plenty of room. Front pouch one zipper middle & back have 2 zippers works well. handle on top easy to carry, Good adjustable waistband Good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for half day hike
customer_reviews.text: Searched through several of these before settling on this one. Took it hiking 4 days and it is the perfect one. Worried about being too big but it is not and still has plenty of room to stash snacks, water, and much more.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Sharar

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I like this pack but would suggest they add taller side water bottle pockets. Some of the liter size bottles are tall and it makes this awkward to carry on anything other than flat trails. But I really like the rest of the pack.
customer_reviews.author: Bas

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and functional
customer_reviews.text: Great bag with lots of storage. I initially bought it for my weekend job in home healthcare where I need to be able to carry quite a bit of stuff but be able to access the things easily and my backpack was becoming too cumbersome. This has been perfect for hands free extra space. I now use it all week as basically my purse.
customer_reviews.author: Angela T

customer_reviews.title: Tough and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Can’t believe how well made this hip pack is. Perfect for short hikes especially when I take the dog. There’s plenty of room for doggie bags and treats. The 3 zippered compartments make for easy organization. The straps, buckles and fabric all seem tough enough to make it through many hikes. It’s a lot of pack for the money. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this fanny pack. My daughter is a sport trainer at her school and she use this for football and basketball ball season. I had her name put on it
customer_reviews.author: sp

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I actually got this for hiking with my dog. The center of gravity makes it easier to carry needed items in a way that is not too strenuous on my back. Its very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: Got this based off a good review from someone who was just about my size. She's right - good size and carries quite a bit. Two full-sized metal water bottles, a first aid kit and some Cliff bars - and there was room to spare - could have put phone and keys and more in there. Not bulky or hot either. Fast and easy to put on and adjust and went hiking in the Rockies with it.
customer_reviews.author: LKP

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a quality product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the Great Saunter in NYC - a 32 mile walk around the perimeter of Manhattan. It was perfect - tons of storage and easily held two waterbottles. This brand is high quality and an extremely good value for what it is. You could pay 3x as much for a similar product with a brand name on it. Fantastic. HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley L. Hammann

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: It is light weight. I was hoping the material was stronger and stiffer. I usually wear my Fannie pack on my hips but when I wear this pack it pulls down. So now I have to wear it around my waist which is not very comfortable to me. It has multiple compartments which a plus. Just a personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy Mini-Pack for Sightseeing!
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a vacation, intending to use it for day pack stuff for me and our Chihuahua. My husband ended up using it to hold his extra camera lenses and etc - way easier than a bulky camera bag, easy to get at the lenses when he wanted to change them. Loved the spot for water bottles also. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am a Teacher Assistant for those with special needs. I pack a lot into my fanny packs. I was completely disappointed with this brand. The belt was constantly loosening and when I tightened it, I couldn't open the bottom two zippers. I'm ordering another new one and it won't be the Waterfly brand
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big Folks Friendly!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I am working on my weightloss and i am a pretty big girl.. The straps are super long buuuut I still needed another 2 to 3 inches amd the sell an extender!!! It was great!! And made me feel alot better. People always tell big people to loose weight...but they dont make clothes or gear to that we can fit and use. They thought about people like me I am 427lbs down from 598. I still habe a long way to go...but small things like this feel good that someone cared enough.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn King

customer_reviews.title: Waist pack that is well made and holds a lot!
customer_reviews.text: I have used a waist pack for many years and always had a difficult time finding one that was well made. I have been very satisfied with this purchase. The pack is comfortable and the zippers appear to be reinforced so that they do not fail after using it for a short time. Several packs that I have purchased in the past had zippers that failed a couple of weeks or months after I received them. I would definitely order this product again.
customer_reviews.author: YMW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hiking pack
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hiking pack. I used it on a recent trip to a national park where we did a lot of walking and it carries plenty of water, snacks, sunscreen, etc. It was also really nice to be able to wear it with the cross body strap, and a few days I used both the waist belt and cross-body shoulder strap together when I had it loaded down with a lot of water, to better distribute the weight.
customer_reviews.author: E.Marie

customer_reviews.title: Took The Weight Off My Shoulders
customer_reviews.text: I took my first hike with this fanny pack yesterday. It was large enough to carry all the things I needed, including two large Starbucks water bottles on each side. I never felt I was carrying a heavy load and it was so nice not to have any weight on my shoulders. Well made. A great product.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon R. Giannini

customer_reviews.title: I'm in my final months of med school and this has been fantastic for me
customer_reviews.text: It's comfortable. Anything can fit inside the fanny bag because it has a bunch of zippers and pockets. I was in a music festival where it rained real hard and all the electronics I had inside it remained in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Perfect size to take everything I need with me on a bike ride or to the dog park. I can fit tennis balls, poop bags, my phone, water bottle, snacks, wallet, etc for a trip out with the dogs. The perfect size for a light day out
customer_reviews.author: emily White

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Great. I use as a camp director, walking all over camp all day to stay hydrated and keep essential things on my person. It's been great. Also used as a parent helper for school field trip to carry my water, wallet, phone, etc. It's a good size--big enough to hold what I need without getting too heavy or bulky
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easily adjustable and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: After my last bag fell apart after 11 years, I needed to find a new bag for my daily 5 mile walks. The bags I found at the local sporting goods stores were too small to hold the 'essential' items, such as an umbrella. I ordered the waterfly after reading the reviews. I've been using it for about a month and love it. The straps are easy to adjust and I like the adjustment straps by the water pouches to pull them in closer.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Reed

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, but does not fit my propose.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product, and well made as far as I can tell. I was looking for something that I can wear with my back pack, to allow me to reach my water and a few essentials, easily. I am returning this because it is larger than I need, and the padded area on the waist belt cannot be worn with the hip belt on my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Jedamski

customer_reviews.title: Used for a walker!
customer_reviews.text: Well made and comfortable, but a little too big for what I purchased it for. I didn’t end up using for my trip, but did find a great, unexpected use for it! Attached to my brother’s walker with the strap and some bag ties for extra security after hip surgery so he could carry his drink, phone, tablet, snacks, wallet, etc.! It was a perfect solution and made him more independence while recovering. Plus it looks super sporty and cool!
customer_reviews.author: Miale G

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I use this while running, hiking, and any outdoor exercise. It looks and feels great. It fits everything I need and then some. Due to it being a bit on the bulky side, I’d recommend getting a slimmer one as well for working out indoors. I use this often and I definitely got my monies worth.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: I like that you can use your own
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use at the theme parks in Orlando. It has 2 pockets on the sides for your own water bottles. I like that you can use your own. THe other pockets are very large and roomy. I will update this after I use it in the Theme park. I however really see this as being everything I was looking for! It fits well too.
customer_reviews.author: Solstice

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best!
customer_reviews.text: This was PERFECT!! I wore it for the Women's March on Washington, and it easily held everything I needed for the entire day. I used the neck strap as well as the waist belt, and I could barely tell I was wearing it. Easy access to all the pockets, rugged construction, and attractive design. The carrying handle was handy when I took the pack off to board the bus. I would give this ten stars if I could!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good hiking pack...
customer_reviews.text: I like this pack...it holds 2 water bottles and I like that they're secure in their holders...they don't fall out...you can carry a lot in the pack...phone, dog treats, poop bags for the dog, granola bars, tweezers, tissues, pepper spray and much, much more....its a little smaller than I'm used to but it really holds a lot plus its waterproof...already have been snowed and rained on and everything stayed dry...only problem I have is that the straps around your waist loosen up sometimes but otherwise a really good pack!!
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this pack and use it for dog training, walking, and take it anywhere I don't want to be carrying a purse. I will be taking it to a water park but everything inside will be in no less than 2 ziploc bags. I don't know how water resistant this pack is yet.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Travel tool
customer_reviews.text: This is my travel wallet. I used this pack hold water bottles, money, baby wipes, wallets, small firts aid kid, smartphones and much more. Hands and back free of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: GREATTTTT
customer_reviews.text: Waterfly always has good packs!! This is the second one ive gotten for my boyfriend. he has one for work, and then i git him this for our little girl (diaper bag replacement!!). we call it the Daddy Pack :)
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great waist pack!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this fanny pack! It is great to put my necessities in while at the zoo etc. Now I ddon't have to be worried that my purse, phone, or key will get stollen. It has so much room in it and isn't heavy either. I have never put a water bottle in the side but have no douby that it would work just fine. I get peoplw who ask me about it all the time and say, "What a good idea!" It's a high quality product that will stand up to years of amusement park and zoo trips!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fanny pack for hiking and so far it is perfect. It is lightweight yet big enough for phone, sunglasses and a few snacks. I love having 2 water bottle slots.
customer_reviews.author: cj4447

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking while babywearing
customer_reviews.text: This pack adjusts down very small which is great as I am very thin. Holds plenty of stuff. I am using it as a front pack as I am babywearing. I only wish their was elastic netting on the front where I could strap down wet clothes or my toddler's hat.
customer_reviews.author: ConscientiousMomma16

customer_reviews.title: Durable and convenient for carrying all essentials
customer_reviews.text: I love this fanny pack for taking my dogs for a walk because I have plenty of room for everything I need, I bought it to take on vacation to wear when we are on a walk-a-bout or just shopping...for exercising I find it a bit clumsy and in the way...all in all it's durable and convenient for carrying all the essentials...
customer_reviews.author: Tracey L. Belgum

customer_reviews.title: Great Fanny pack
customer_reviews.text: I brought this fanny pack to use when I do my daily walk. It has so many pockets that I can carry almost my entire purse content. It also have the 2 water bottle holders and an extra bonus of a shoulder strap. I purchased 3, for my daughter and sister and they love it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Elane

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pack For Me!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect pack for me. I love the different compartments and the shoulder strap as well as the waist strap. Most "fanny packs" I own don't have the shoulder strap which make it difficult to use when I want to use it for something other than hiking. I also love the water bottle holders on the sides. This is exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Lo Becker

customer_reviews.title: Bikepacking, diaper packing, and everything in between
customer_reviews.text: I've had this fanny pack for over two years now. I originally bought it for paternity leave, so I could walk around the park and carry my kid around in a Bjorn. This thing held my coffee, a bottle of milk, diapers, wipes, and spare baby clothes. A+ dad pack. Recently, I've been using it for mountain biking and bike touring. I just spent a weekend bikepacking along the California coast and used this to hold my essentials - phone, energy bars, etc. It felt great, even when I was riding through some pretty rough terrain. So yeah, this is a pretty awesome bag!
customer_reviews.author: Ruqoiy

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, cute and very well made.
customer_reviews.text: So well made! I use it for hiking with my large dog. Fits my huge water bottle, so well designed with pockets for bags, face mask, sunblock, bug spray. Comfortable even in GA humid heat! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Buckeye88

customer_reviews.title: Great waist pack for hiking, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for hiking and I’m very happy with this pack. I had a backpack before and the straps rubbed on my arms and when I would run it would bounce around. It also made my upper back hurt. This around the waist solves those problems. It fits quite a bit of things in it too. Definitely worth it for the price. It seems really well made for the price. I’m very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Denis Friezner

customer_reviews.title: Love at first Sight!
customer_reviews.text: This sport Bag totally exceeded my expectations. The compartments are roomy and plentiful. The bottle holders are perfect for 16 oz size. The fit is comfortable. Got this wanting a great bag all around bag and GOT it! The color is terrific can be used for either gender. The one I got says pink but it's dark enough to almost be a cross between a maroon, wine color mix. Belt has plenty of length for large adult to adjust down also. I'm loving this for overall use. Not too big not too small. Rain seems to repel good off of it. Comfortable to wear. A hit with friends and grandchildren.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Parker

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Pretty color
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Pretty color, well made, great size. There are 3 zippered sections. In the smallest section I keep my cell phone, blue tooth, and business cards. The next section is large and also has 2 mesh pockets and an attachment for keys. And the other section is large and has also has a large pocket. Large enough to carry sunglasses in large case, pocket camera, wallet, rain poncho, and more. Can keep 8 oz or 16 oz water bottles in side mesh pockets, or a small antibacterial soap, etc. I've gotten gotten compliments. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Gumenick

customer_reviews.title: It is PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: I expected it to be heavy and/or uncomfortable because I need it to carry two bottles of water (one for me.. one for the dog) and was so pleasantly surprised to find that not only is it NOT uncomfortable - the width of the back combined with the ability to tighten up the straps around the bottles provides lumbar support which is so helpful since I suffer from back problems. Highly recommend this product. The pack itself is spacious and well made. I do wish that the belt straps weren't so long but that is an easy fix. Thank YOU!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Grace

customer_reviews.title: A thumbs up for this bag.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I bought a similar bag a couple of years back and it was awful, the bottles popped out once I started peddling my bike, and there was really no room in the bag compartment. This one, it's awesome, lots of room, compact, and you can hold two 16 to 20 ounces water bottles (that will make it heavy, so try it out before hitting the road, you might not want the extra weight). A thumbs up for this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Tad

customer_reviews.title: Like some other reviews mentioned
customer_reviews.text: Like some other reviews mentioned, the straps do losen fairly easy in certain angles. For example if the straps are clipped together and you pick it up from the clips the straps immediately start loosening. Other than that it's a pretty good hip pack with good amount of storage space.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Small (can not fit large water bottles!!!) but comfy
customer_reviews.text: This is smaller than advertised and WILL NOT fit large water bottles (32oz. +). I think that it is a fine walking pack but it will only fit a few things. It does fit very well across the hips and is easily adjustable which is why it garners 3 stars even after the misleading information.
customer_reviews.author: Emily E.

customer_reviews.title: The clip to hold keys is great as well as the mesh pockets
customer_reviews.text: The interior pocket had me sold. The clip to hold keys is great as well as the mesh pockets. Love that I can carry water for myself on one side and water for my pup on the other for our hikes/walks. Fits all my needs and has room left over. Color was lighter than what photo looked like on the blue. The big zipper pouch also had an additional pocket that is great for cash or ID. Will be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice pack
customer_reviews.text: So far (3-4 months) this has been a great little pack. I wanted something that was compact and durable. The bottle holders are the perfect size and secure your water vessels well. There is plenty of room inside for wallets, keys, phones and food. Yet its narrow and stable enough to not obstruct your arm swing for vigorous hikes and even some periodic running ( there are better products out there for hard-core runners).
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not well made
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this pack a few months over 1 year and use it only a few times a week to walk my dog. One of the sides that I put my water bottle is ripping and falling apart. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Nice Color - Larger Fanny Pack
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought the 1 bottled waterfly but that was very small. This one is probably a little too big but this is what I plan on wearing on my trip to Disneyworld. Should be able to carry everything I need plus there is room for 2 water bottles. Tried the 16.9 oz. and they fit pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: LadyDi56

customer_reviews.title: A very very nice product!
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly surprised at how good this pack is. I've used it about 4 times. It's very light, comfortable and roomy. I cannot speak to the durability of the materials or zippers, but I will say they appear to be durable. I'm very happy with this purchase. Also, my standard water bottles easily fit and can be secured with straps attached. I had originally purchased a similar product, but the bottle holders were too small.
customer_reviews.author: by the sea

customer_reviews.title: Good mini diaper bag for mom.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a mom who has problem with my neck and back. That’s the reason I’m started to looking for hippack. With this bag, I can carry some diapers and wipes and water bottle for me and my 1 year son, for our half day trip. By the way, I don’t like its looks much. It’s bulky. And the starps are so messy. The matherial is hard and unbreatable at all. So it makes my waist sweat all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Nattaya Penekwong

product_meta.title: WATERFLY Fanny Pack with Water Bottle Holder Hiking Waist Packs for Walking Running Lumbar Pack fit for iPhone iPod Samsung Phones
feature_bullets: TIPS:Bottles not included. Made of Nylon, high-grade PV valentine breathable pads, high quality and durable, better ventilation not easy to deformation; It Can strengthen the reflective intensity in the night, have the effect of safety warning.
Portable hand carry design, large bearing capacity, ribbon durability can be at ease use, Super versatile and multi-functional pack that has a main compartment and outer pockets.
Adjustable waist belt size rank: 22''~52''. Fully Adjustable Strap, unique design straps ease the pressure on the Waist.
WATERFLY waist bag is ideal for various activities such as Jogging, Walking, Cycling, Hiking, Holidays, and so much more.
Waist bag design on both sides have a gauze pocket side bunker Portable water, beverages, food, books, such as mobile phones.
